externalDocs.description: Swagger for Payment Initiation API Specification

parameters.name: x-fapi-auth-date
parameters.description:
The time when the PSU last logged in with the TPP. 
All dates in the HTTP headers are represented as RFC 7231 Full Dates. An example is below: 
Sun, 10 Sep 2017 19:43:31 UTC

parameters.name: x-fapi-customer-ip-address
parameters.description: The PSU's IP address if the PSU is currently logged in with the TPP.

parameters.name: x-fapi-interaction-id
parameters.description: An RFC4122 UID used as a correlation id.

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: An Authorisation Token as per https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6750

parameters.name: x-idempotency-key
parameters.description:
Every request will be processed only once per x-idempotency-key.  The

Idempotency Key will be valid for 24 hours.

parameters.name: x-jws-signature
parameters.description: A detached JWS signature of the body of the payload.

parameters.name: x-customer-user-agent
parameters.description: Indicates the user-agent that the PSU is using.

schema.title: body
schema.description: Default

Risk.title: Risk
Risk.description: The Risk section is sent by the initiating party to the ASPSP. It is used to specify additional details for risk scoring for Payments.

MerchantCategoryCode.title: MerchantCategoryCode
MerchantCategoryCode.description: Category code conform to ISO 18245, related to the type of services or goods the merchant provides for the transaction.

MerchantCustomerIdentification.title: MerchantCustomerIdentification
MerchantCustomerIdentification.description: The unique customer identifier of the PSU with the merchant.

x-fapi-interaction-id.title: x-fapi-interaction-id
x-fapi-interaction-id.description: An RFC4122 UID used as a correlation id.

x-jws-signature.title: x-jws-signature
x-jws-signature.description: Header containing a detached JWS signature of the body of the payload.

Meta.title: Meta
Meta.description: Meta Data relevant to the payload

LastAvailableDateTime.title: LastAvailableDateTime
LastAvailableDateTime.description:
All dates in the JSON payloads are represented in ISO 8601 date-time format. 
All date-time fields in responses must include the timezone. An example is below:
2017-04-05T10:43:07+00:00

MerchantCategoryCode.title: MerchantCategoryCode
MerchantCategoryCode.description: Category code conform to ISO 18245, related to the type of services or goods the merchant provides for the transaction.

MerchantCustomerIdentification.title: MerchantCustomerIdentification
MerchantCustomerIdentification.description: The unique customer identifier of the PSU with the merchant.

x-fapi-interaction-id.title: x-fapi-interaction-id
x-fapi-interaction-id.description: An RFC4122 UID used as a correlation id.

x-jws-signature.title: x-jws-signature
x-jws-signature.description: Header containing a detached JWS signature of the body of the payload.

Code.description: High level textual error code, to help categorize the errors.

parameters.name: x-fapi-auth-date
parameters.description:
The time when the PSU last logged in with the TPP. 
All dates in the HTTP headers are represented as RFC 7231 Full Dates. An example is below: 
Sun, 10 Sep 2017 19:43:31 UTC

parameters.name: x-fapi-customer-ip-address
parameters.description: The PSU's IP address if the PSU is currently logged in with the TPP.

parameters.name: x-fapi-interaction-id
parameters.description: An RFC4122 UID used as a correlation id.

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: An Authorisation Token as per https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6750

parameters.name: x-idempotency-key
parameters.description:
Every request will be processed only once per x-idempotency-key.  The

Idempotency Key will be valid for 24 hours.

parameters.name: x-jws-signature
parameters.description: A detached JWS signature of the body of the payload.

parameters.name: x-customer-user-agent
parameters.description: Indicates the user-agent that the PSU is using.

ReadRefundAccount.title: ReadRefundAccount
ReadRefundAccount.description: Specifies to share the refund account details with PISP

SCASupportData.title: SCASupportData
SCASupportData.description: Supporting Data provided by TPP, when requesting SCA Exemption.

AppliedAuthenticationApproach.title: AppliedAuthenticationApproach
AppliedAuthenticationApproach.description:
Specifies a character string with a maximum length of 40 characters.

Usage: This field indicates whether the PSU was subject to SCA performed by the TPP

ReferencePaymentOrderId.title: ReferencePaymentOrderId
ReferencePaymentOrderId.description: If the payment is recurring, then this field is populated with the transaction identifier of the previous payment occurrence so that the ASPSP can verify that the PISP, amount and the payee are the same as the previous occurrence. The value here refers to the payment id e.g. DomesticPaymentId

RequestedSCAExemptionType.title: RequestedSCAExemptionType
RequestedSCAExemptionType.description: This field allows a PISP to request specific SCA Exemption for a Payment Initiation

DeliveryAddress.title: DeliveryAddress
DeliveryAddress.description: Information that locates and identifies a specific address, as defined by postal services or in free format text.

StreetName.title: StreetName
StreetName.description: Name of a street or thoroughfare.

BuildingNumber.title: BuildingNumber
BuildingNumber.description: Number that identifies the position of a building on a street.

PostCode.title: PostCode
PostCode.description: Identifier consisting of a group of letters and/or numbers that is added to a postal address to assist the sorting of mail.

TownName.title: TownName
TownName.description: Name of a built-up area, with defined boundaries, and a local government.

CountrySubDivision.title: CountrySubDivision
CountrySubDivision.description: Identifies a subdivision of a country such as state, region, county.

Country.title: Country
Country.description: Nation with its own government, occupying a particular territory.

ConsentId.title: ConsentId
ConsentId.description: OB: Unique identification as assigned by the ASPSP to uniquely identify the consent resource.

CreationDateTime.title: CreationDateTime
CreationDateTime.description:
Date and time at which the resource was created.All dates in the JSON payloads are represented in ISO 8601 date-time format. 
All date-time fields in responses must include the timezone. An example is below:
2017-04-05T10:43:07+00:00

Status.description: Specifies the status of consent resource in code form.

2017-04-05T10:43:07+00:00

ReadRefundAccount.description: Specifies to share the refund account details with PISP

Initiation.title: Initiation
Initiation.description: The Initiation payload is sent by the initiating party to the ASPSP. It is used to request movement of funds from the debtor account to a creditor for a single domestic payment.

InstructionIdentification.title: InstructionIdentification
InstructionIdentification.description:
Unique identification as assigned by an instructing party for an instructed party to unambiguously identify the instruction.

Usage: the  instruction identification is a point to point reference that can be used between the instructing party and the instructed party to refer to the individual instruction. It can be included in several messages related to the instruction.

EndToEndIdentification.title: EndToEndIdentification
EndToEndIdentification.description:
Unique identification assigned by the initiating party to unambiguously identify the transaction. This identification is passed on, unchanged, throughout the entire end-to-end chain.

Usage: The end-to-end identification can be used for reconciliation or to link tasks relating to the transaction. It can be included in several messages related to the transaction.

OB: The Faster Payments Scheme can only access 31 characters for the EndToEndIdentification field.

SubDepartment.description: Identification of a sub-division of a large organisation or building.

Department.title: Department
Department.description: Identification of a division of a large organisation or building.

AddressType.title: AddressType
AddressType.description: Identifies the nature of the postal address.

PostCode.title: PostCode
PostCode.description: Identifier consisting of a group of letters and/or numbers that is added to a postal address to assist the sorting of mail.

BuildingNumber.title: BuildingNumber
BuildingNumber.description: Number that identifies the position of a building on a street.

SupplementaryData.title: SupplementaryData
SupplementaryData.description: Additional information that can not be captured in the structured fields and/or any other specific block.

Initiation_33.title: Initiation
Initiation_33.description: The Initiation payload is sent by the initiating party to the ASPSP. It is used to request movement of funds from the debtor account to a creditor for a single scheduled domestic payment.

InstructionIdentification.title: InstructionIdentification
InstructionIdentification.description:
Unique identification as assigned by an instructing party for an instructed party to unambiguously identify the instruction.

Usage: the  instruction identification is a point to point reference that can be used between the instructing party and the instructed party to refer to the individual instruction. It can be included in several messages related to the instruction.

EndToEndIdentification.title: EndToEndIdentification
EndToEndIdentification.description:
Unique identification assigned by the initiating party to unambiguously identify the transaction. This identification is passed on, unchanged, throughout the entire end-to-end chain.

Usage: The end-to-end identification can be used for reconciliation or to link tasks relating to the transaction. It can be included in several messages related to the transaction.

OB: The Faster Payments Scheme can only access 31 characters for the EndToEndIdentification field.

LocalInstrument.title: LocalInstrument
LocalInstrument.description:
User community specific instrument.

Usage: This element is used to specify a local instrument, local clearing option and/or further qualify the service or service level.

RequestedExecutionDateTime.title: RequestedExecutionDateTime
RequestedExecutionDateTime.description:
Date at which the initiating party requests the clearing agent to process the payment. 
Usage: This is the date on which the debtor's account is to be debited.All dates in the JSON payloads are represented in ISO 8601 date-time format. 
All date-time fields in responses must include the timezone. An example is below:
2017-04-05T10:43:07+00:00

CreditorPostalAddress.title: CreditorPostalAddress
CreditorPostalAddress.description: Information that locates and identifies a specific address, as defined by postal services.

TownName.title: TownName
TownName.description: Name of a built-up area, with defined boundaries, and a local government.

StreetName.title: StreetName
StreetName.description: Name of a street or thoroughfare.

CountrySubDivision.title: CountrySubDivision
CountrySubDivision.description: Identifies a subdivision of a country such as state, region, county.

SubDepartment.title: SubDepartment
SubDepartment.description: Identification of a sub-division of a large organisation or building.

Department.title: Department
Department.description: Identification of a division of a large organisation or building.

AddressType.title: AddressType
AddressType.description: Identifies the nature of the postal address.

PostCode.title: PostCode
PostCode.description: Identifier consisting of a group of letters and/or numbers that is added to a postal address to assist the sorting of mail.

BuildingNumber.title: BuildingNumber
BuildingNumber.description: Number that identifies the position of a building on a street.

SupplementaryData.title: SupplementaryData
SupplementaryData.description: Additional information that can not be captured in the structured fields and/or any other specific block.

Initiation_34.title: Initiation
Initiation_34.description: The Initiation payload is sent by the initiating party to the ASPSP. It is used to request movement of funds from the debtor account to a creditor for a domestic standing order.

Frequency.title: Frequency
Frequency.description:
Individual Definitions:
EvryDay - Every day
EvryWorkgDay - Every working day
IntrvlWkDay - An interval specified in weeks (01 to 09), and the day within the week (01 to 07)
WkInMnthDay - A monthly interval, specifying the week of the month (01 to 05) and day within the week (01 to 07)
IntrvlMnthDay - An interval specified in months (between 01 to 06, 12, 24), specifying the day within the month (-5 to -1, 1 to 31)
QtrDay - Quarterly (either ENGLISH, SCOTTISH, or RECEIVED). 
ENGLISH = Paid on the 25th March, 24th June, 29th September and 25th December. 
SCOTTISH = Paid on the 2nd February, 15th May, 1st August and 11th November.
RECEIVED = Paid on the 20th March, 19th June, 24th September and 20th December. 
Individual Patterns:
EvryDay (ScheduleCode)
EvryWorkgDay (ScheduleCode)
IntrvlWkDay:IntervalInWeeks:DayInWeek (ScheduleCode + IntervalInWeeks + DayInWeek)
WkInMnthDay:WeekInMonth:DayInWeek (ScheduleCode + WeekInMonth + DayInWeek)
IntrvlMnthDay:IntervalInMonths:DayInMonth (ScheduleCode + IntervalInMonths + DayInMonth)
QtrDay: + either (ENGLISH, SCOTTISH or RECEIVED) ScheduleCode + QuarterDay
The regular expression for this element combines five smaller versions for each permitted pattern. To aid legibility - the components are presented individually here:
EvryDay
EvryWorkgDay
IntrvlWkDay:0[1-9]:0[1-7]
WkInMnthDay:0[1-5]:0[1-7]
IntrvlMnthDay:(0[1-6]|12|24):(-0[1-5]|0[1-9]|[12][0-9]|3[01])
QtrDay:(ENGLISH|SCOTTISH|RECEIVED)
Full Regular Expression:
^(EvryDay)$|^(EvryWorkgDay)$|^(IntrvlWkDay:0[1-9]:0[1-7])$|^(WkInMnthDay:0[1-5]:0[1-7])$|^(IntrvlMnthDay:(0[1-6]|12|24):(-0[1-5]|0[1-9]|[12][0-9]|3[01]))$|^(QtrDay:(ENGLISH|SCOTTISH|RECEIVED))$

Reference.title: Reference
Reference.description:
Unique reference, as assigned by the creditor, to unambiguously refer to the payment transaction.

Usage: If available, the initiating party should provide this reference in the structured remittance information, to enable reconciliation by the creditor upon receipt of the amount of money.

If the business context requires the use of a creditor reference or a payment remit identification, and only one identifier can be passed through the end-to-end chain, the creditor's reference or payment remittance identification should be quoted in the end-to-end transaction identification.

NumberOfPayments.title: NumberOfPayments
NumberOfPayments.description: Number of the payments that will be made in completing this frequency sequence including any executed since the sequence start date.

FirstPaymentDateTime.title: FirstPaymentDateTime
FirstPaymentDateTime.description:
The date on which the first payment for a Standing Order schedule will be made.All dates in the JSON payloads are represented in ISO 8601 date-time format. 
All date-time fields in responses must include the timezone. An example is below:
2017-04-05T10:43:07+00:00

RecurringPaymentDateTime.title: RecurringPaymentDateTime
RecurringPaymentDateTime.description:
The date on which the first recurring payment for a Standing Order schedule will be made. 
Usage: This must be populated only if the first recurring date is different to the first payment date.All dates in the JSON payloads are represented in ISO 8601 date-time format. 
All date-time fields in responses must include the timezone. An example is below:
2017-04-05T10:43:07+00:00

FinalPaymentDateTime.title: FinalPaymentDateTime
FinalPaymentDateTime.description:
The date on which the final payment for a Standing Order schedule will be made.All dates in the JSON payloads are represented in ISO 8601 date-time format. 
All date-time fields in responses must include the timezone. An example is below:
2017-04-05T10:43:07+00:00

DebtorAccount.title: DebtorAccount
DebtorAccount.description: Provides the details to identify the debtor account.

SecondaryIdentification.title: SecondaryIdentification
SecondaryIdentification.description:
This is secondary identification of the account, as assigned by the account servicing institution. 
This can be used by building societies to additionally identify accounts with a roll number (in addition to a sort code and account number combination).

SchemeName.title: SchemeName
SchemeName.description: Name of the identification scheme, in a coded form as published in an external list.

Name.title: Name
Name.description:
The account name is the name or names of the account owner(s) represented at an account level, as displayed by the ASPSP's online channels.

Note, the account name is not the product name or the nickname of the account.

Identification.title: Identification
Identification.description: Identification assigned by an institution to identify an account. This identification is known by the account owner.

CreditorAccount.title: CreditorAccount
CreditorAccount.description: Identification assigned by an institution to identify an account. This identification is known by the account owner.

This can be used by building societies to additionally identify accounts with a roll number (in addition to a sort code and account number combination).

Name.title: Name
Name.description:

Note, the account name is not the product name or the nickname of the account.

OB: ASPSPs may carry out name validation for Confirmation of Payee, but it is not mandatory.

Identification.description: Identification assigned by an institution to identify an account. This identification is known by the account owner.

RequestedExecutionDateTime.title: RequestedExecutionDateTime
RequestedExecutionDateTime.description:
Date at which the initiating party requests the clearing agent to process the payment. 
Usage: This is the date on which the debtor's account is to be debited.All dates in the JSON payloads are represented in ISO 8601 date-time format. 
All date-time fields in responses must include the timezone. An example is below:
2017-04-05T10:43:07+00:00

LocalInstrument.title: LocalInstrument
LocalInstrument.description:
User community specific instrument.

Usage: This element is used to specify a local instrument, local clearing option and/or further qualify the service or service level.

SupplementaryData.title: SupplementaryData
SupplementaryData.description: Additional information that can not be captured in the structured fields and/or any other specific block.

Initiation_41.title: Initiation
Initiation_41.description: The Initiation payload is sent by the initiating party to the ASPSP. It is used to request movement of funds using a payment file.

FileHash.title: FileHash
FileHash.description: A base64 encoding of a SHA256 hash of the file to be uploaded.

NumberOfTransactions.title: NumberOfTransactions
NumberOfTransactions.description: Number of individual transactions contained in the payment information group.

ControlSum.title: ControlSum
ControlSum.description: Total of all individual amounts included in the group, irrespective of currencies.

Initiation_42.title: Initiation
Initiation_42.description: The Initiation payload is sent by the initiating party to the ASPSP. It is used to request movement of funds from the debtor account to a creditor for a single international payment.

InstructionIdentification.title: InstructionIdentification
InstructionIdentification.description:
Unique identification as assigned by an instructing party for an instructed party to unambiguously identify the instruction.

Usage: the  instruction identification is a point to point reference that can be used between the instructing party and the instructed party to refer to the individual instruction. It can be included in several messages related to the instruction.

EndToEndIdentification.title: EndToEndIdentification
EndToEndIdentification.description:
Unique identification assigned by the initiating party to unambiguously identify the transaction. This identification is passed on, unchanged, throughout the entire end-to-end chain.

Usage: The end-to-end identification can be used for reconciliation or to link tasks relating to the transaction. It can be included in several messages related to the transaction.

OB: The Faster Payments Scheme can only access 31 characters for the EndToEndIdentification field.

LocalInstrument.title: LocalInstrument
LocalInstrument.description:
User community specific instrument.

Usage: This element is used to specify a local instrument, local clearing option and/or further qualify the service or service level.

InstructionPriority.title: InstructionPriority
InstructionPriority.description: Indicator of the urgency or order of importance that the instructing party would like the instructed party to apply to the processing of the instruction.

Purpose.title: Purpose
Purpose.description:
Specifies the external purpose code in the format of character string with a maximum length of 4 characters.

The list of valid codes is an external code list published separately.

External code sets can be downloaded from www.iso20022.org.

ExtendedPurpose.title: ExtendedPurpose
ExtendedPurpose.description: Specifies the purpose of an international payment, when there is no corresponding 4 character code available in the ISO20022 list of Purpose Codes.

ChargeBearer.title: ChargeBearer
ChargeBearer.description: Specifies which party/parties will bear the charges associated with the processing of the payment transaction.

CurrencyOfTransfer.title: CurrencyOfTransfer
CurrencyOfTransfer.description: Specifies the currency of the to be transferred amount, which is different from the currency of the debtor's account.

DestinationCountryCode.title: DestinationCountryCode
DestinationCountryCode.description: Country in which Credit Account is domiciled. Code to identify a country, a dependency, or another area of particular geopolitical interest, on the basis of country names obtained from the United Nations (ISO 3166, Alpha-2 code).

SupplementaryData.title: SupplementaryData
SupplementaryData.description: Additional information that can not be captured in the structured fields and/or any other specific block.

ExchangeRateInformation.title: ExchangeRateInformation
ExchangeRateInformation.description: Further detailed information on the exchange rate that has been used in the payment transaction.

UnitCurrency.title: UnitCurrency
UnitCurrency.description: Currency in which the rate of exchange is expressed in a currency exchange. In the example 1GBP = xxxCUR, the unit currency is GBP.

ExchangeRate.title: ExchangeRate
ExchangeRate.description: The factor used for conversion of an amount from one currency to another. This reflects the price at which one currency was bought with another currency.

RateType.title: RateType
RateType.description: Specifies the type used to complete the currency exchange.

ContractIdentification.title: ContractIdentification
ContractIdentification.description: Unique and unambiguous reference to the foreign exchange contract agreed between the initiating party/creditor and the debtor agent.

Purpose.description:
Specifies the external purpose code in the format of character string with a maximum length of 4 characters.

The list of valid codes is an external code list published separately.

External code sets can be downloaded from www.iso20022.org.

ExtendedPurpose.title: ExtendedPurpose
ExtendedPurpose.description: Specifies the purpose of an international payment, when there is no corresponding 4 character code available in the ISO20022 list of Purpose Codes.

ChargeBearer.title: ChargeBearer
ChargeBearer.description: Specifies which party/parties will bear the charges associated with the processing of the payment transaction.

RequestedExecutionDateTime.title: RequestedExecutionDateTime
RequestedExecutionDateTime.description:
Date at which the initiating party requests the clearing agent to process the payment. 
Usage: This is the date on which the debtor's account is to be debited.All dates in the JSON payloads are represented in ISO 8601 date-time format. 
All date-time fields in responses must include the timezone. An example is below:
2017-04-05T10:43:07+00:00

CurrencyOfTransfer.title: CurrencyOfTransfer
CurrencyOfTransfer.description: Specifies the currency of the to be transferred amount, which is different from the currency of the debtor's account.

DestinationCountryCode.title: DestinationCountryCode
DestinationCountryCode.description: Country in which Credit Account is domiciled. Code to identify a country, a dependency, or another area of particular geopolitical interest, on the basis of country names obtained from the United Nations (ISO 3166, Alpha-2 code).

SupplementaryData.title: SupplementaryData
SupplementaryData.description: Additional information that can not be captured in the structured fields and/or any other specific block.

Initiation_55.title: Initiation
Initiation_55.description: The Initiation payload is sent by the initiating party to the ASPSP. It is used to request movement of funds from the debtor account to a creditor for an international standing order.

Frequency.title: Frequency
Frequency.description:
Individual Definitions:
EvryDay - Every day
EvryWorkgDay - Every working day
IntrvlWkDay - An interval specified in weeks (01 to 09), and the day within the week (01 to 07)
WkInMnthDay - A monthly interval, specifying the week of the month (01 to 05) and day within the week (01 to 07)
IntrvlMnthDay - An interval specified in months (between 01 to 06, 12, 24), specifying the day within the month (-5 to -1, 1 to 31)
QtrDay - Quarterly (either ENGLISH, SCOTTISH, or RECEIVED). 
ENGLISH = Paid on the 25th March, 24th June, 29th September and 25th December. 
SCOTTISH = Paid on the 2nd February, 15th May, 1st August and 11th November.
RECEIVED = Paid on the 20th March, 19th June, 24th September and 20th December. 
Individual Patterns:
EvryDay (ScheduleCode)
EvryWorkgDay (ScheduleCode)
IntrvlWkDay:IntervalInWeeks:DayInWeek (ScheduleCode + IntervalInWeeks + DayInWeek)
WkInMnthDay:WeekInMonth:DayInWeek (ScheduleCode + WeekInMonth + DayInWeek)
IntrvlMnthDay:IntervalInMonths:DayInMonth (ScheduleCode + IntervalInMonths + DayInMonth)
QtrDay: + either (ENGLISH, SCOTTISH or RECEIVED) ScheduleCode + QuarterDay
The regular expression for this element combines five smaller versions for each permitted pattern. To aid legibility - the components are presented individually here:
EvryDay
EvryWorkgDay
IntrvlWkDay:0[1-9]:0[1-7]
WkInMnthDay:0[1-5]:0[1-7]
IntrvlMnthDay:(0[1-6]|12|24):(-0[1-5]|0[1-9]|[12][0-9]|3[01])
QtrDay:(ENGLISH|SCOTTISH|RECEIVED)
Full Regular Expression:
^(EvryDay)$|^(EvryWorkgDay)$|^(IntrvlWkDay:0[1-9]:0[1-7])$|^(WkInMnthDay:0[1-5]:0[1-7])$|^(IntrvlMnthDay:(0[1-6]|12|24):(-0[1-5]|0[1-9]|[12][0-9]|3[01]))$|^(QtrDay:(ENGLISH|SCOTTISH|RECEIVED))$

Reference.title: Reference
Reference.description:
Unique reference, as assigned by the creditor, to unambiguously refer to the payment transaction.

Usage: If available, the initiating party should provide this reference in the structured remittance information, to enable reconciliation by the creditor upon receipt of the amount of money.

If the business context requires the use of a creditor reference or a payment remit identification, and only one identifier can be passed through the end-to-end chain, the creditor's reference or payment remittance identification should be quoted in the end-to-end transaction identification.

NumberOfPayments.title: NumberOfPayments
NumberOfPayments.description: Number of the payments that will be made in completing this frequency sequence including any executed since the sequence start date.

FirstPaymentDateTime.title: FirstPaymentDateTime
FirstPaymentDateTime.description:
The date on which the first payment for a Standing Order schedule will be made.All dates in the JSON payloads are represented in ISO 8601 date-time format. 
All date-time fields in responses must include the timezone. An example is below:
2017-04-05T10:43:07+00:00

SecondaryIdentification.title: SecondaryIdentification
SecondaryIdentification.description:
This is secondary identification of the account, as assigned by the account servicing institution. 
This can be used by building societies to additionally identify accounts with a roll number (in addition to a sort code and account number combination).

SchemeName.title: SchemeName
SchemeName.description: Name of the identification scheme, in a coded form as published in an external list.

Name.title: Name
Name.description:
The account name is the name or names of the account owner(s) represented at an account level, as displayed by the ASPSP's online channels.

Note, the account name is not the product name or the nickname of the account.

Identification.title: Identification
Identification.description: Identification assigned by an institution to identify an account. This identification is known by the account owner.

Creditor.title: Creditor
Creditor.description: Party to which an amount of money is due.

Name.title: Name
Name.description: Name by which a party is known and which is usually used to identify that party.

PostalAddress.title: PostalAddress
PostalAddress.description: Information that locates and identifies a specific address, as defined by postal services.

TownName.title: TownName
TownName.description: Name of a built-up area, with defined boundaries, and a local government.

StreetName.title: StreetName
StreetName.description: Name of a street or thoroughfare.

CountrySubDivision.title: CountrySubDivision
CountrySubDivision.description: Identifies a subdivision of a country such as state, region, county.

SubDepartment.title: SubDepartment
SubDepartment.description: Identification of a sub-division of a large organisation or building.

Department.title: Department
Department.description: Identification of a division of a large organisation or building.

AddressType.title: AddressType
AddressType.description: Identifies the nature of the postal address.

PostCode.title: PostCode
PostCode.description: Identifier consisting of a group of letters and/or numbers that is added to a postal address to assist the sorting of mail.

BuildingNumber.title: BuildingNumber
BuildingNumber.description: Number that identifies the position of a building on a street.

CreditorAgent.title: CreditorAgent
CreditorAgent.description:
Party that manages the account on behalf of the account owner, that is manages the registration and booking of entries on the account, calculates balances on the account and provides information about the account.

This is the servicer of the beneficiary account.

Initiation_59.title: Initiation
Initiation_59.description: The Initiation payload is sent by the initiating party to the ASPSP. It is used to request movement of funds from the debtor account to a creditor for an international standing order.

Frequency.title: Frequency
Frequency.description:
Individual Definitions:
EvryDay - Every day
EvryWorkgDay - Every working day
IntrvlWkDay - An interval specified in weeks (01 to 09), and the day within the week (01 to 07)
WkInMnthDay - A monthly interval, specifying the week of the month (01 to 05) and day within the week (01 to 07)
IntrvlMnthDay - An interval specified in months (between 01 to 06, 12, 24), specifying the day within the month (-5 to -1, 1 to 31)
QtrDay - Quarterly (either ENGLISH, SCOTTISH, or RECEIVED). 
ENGLISH = Paid on the 25th March, 24th June, 29th September and 25th December. 
SCOTTISH = Paid on the 2nd February, 15th May, 1st August and 11th November.
RECEIVED = Paid on the 20th March, 19th June, 24th September and 20th December. 
Individual Patterns:
EvryDay (ScheduleCode)
EvryWorkgDay (ScheduleCode)
IntrvlWkDay:IntervalInWeeks:DayInWeek (ScheduleCode + IntervalInWeeks + DayInWeek)
WkInMnthDay:WeekInMonth:DayInWeek (ScheduleCode + WeekInMonth + DayInWeek)
IntrvlMnthDay:IntervalInMonths:DayInMonth (ScheduleCode + IntervalInMonths + DayInMonth)
QtrDay: + either (ENGLISH, SCOTTISH or RECEIVED) ScheduleCode + QuarterDay
The regular expression for this element combines five smaller versions for each permitted pattern. To aid legibility - the components are presented individually here:
EvryDay
EvryWorkgDay
IntrvlWkDay:0[1-9]:0[1-7]
WkInMnthDay:0[1-5]:0[1-7]
IntrvlMnthDay:(0[1-6]|12|24):(-0[1-5]|0[1-9]|[12][0-9]|3[01])
QtrDay:(ENGLISH|SCOTTISH|RECEIVED)
Full Regular Expression:
^(EvryDay)$|^(EvryWorkgDay)$|^(IntrvlWkDay:0[1-9]:0[1-7])$|^(WkInMnthDay:0[1-5]:0[1-7])$|^(IntrvlMnthDay:(0[1-6]|12|24):(-0[1-5]|0[1-9]|[12][0-9]|3[01]))$|^(QtrDay:(ENGLISH|SCOTTISH|RECEIVED))$

Reference.title: Reference
Reference.description:
Unique reference, as assigned by the creditor, to unambiguously refer to the payment transaction.

Usage: If available, the initiating party should provide this reference in the structured remittance information, to enable reconciliation by the creditor upon receipt of the amount of money.

If the business context requires the use of a creditor reference or a payment remit identification, and only one identifier can be passed through the end-to-end chain, the creditor's reference or payment remittance identification should be quoted in the end-to-end transaction identification.

NumberOfPayments.title: NumberOfPayments
NumberOfPayments.description: Number of the payments that will be made in completing this frequency sequence including any executed since the sequence start date.

FirstPaymentDateTime.title: FirstPaymentDateTime
FirstPaymentDateTime.description:
The date on which the first payment for a Standing Order schedule will be made.All dates in the JSON payloads are represented in ISO 8601 date-time format. 
All date-time fields in responses must include the timezone. An example is below:
2017-04-05T10:43:07+00:00

FinalPaymentDateTime.title: FinalPaymentDateTime
FinalPaymentDateTime.description:
The date on which the final payment for a Standing Order schedule will be made.All dates in the JSON payloads are represented in ISO 8601 date-time format. 
All date-time fields in responses must include the timezone. An example is below:
2017-04-05T10:43:07+00:00

Purpose.title: Purpose
Purpose.description:
Specifies the external purpose code in the format of character string with a maximum length of 4 characters.

The list of valid codes is an external code list published separately.

External code sets can be downloaded from www.iso20022.org.

ExtendedPurpose.title: ExtendedPurpose
ExtendedPurpose.description: Specifies the purpose of an international payment, when there is no corresponding 4 character code available in the ISO20022 list of Purpose Codes.

ChargeBearer.title: ChargeBearer
ChargeBearer.description: Specifies which party/parties will bear the charges associated with the processing of the payment transaction.

CurrencyOfTransfer.title: CurrencyOfTransfer
CurrencyOfTransfer.description: Specifies the currency of the to be transferred amount, which is different from the currency of the debtor's account.

DestinationCountryCode.title: DestinationCountryCode
DestinationCountryCode.description: Country in which Credit Account is domiciled. Code to identify a country, a dependency, or another area of particular geopolitical interest, on the basis of country names obtained from the United Nations (ISO 3166, Alpha-2 code).

Creditor.title: Creditor
Creditor.description: Party to which an amount of money is due.

Name.title: Name
Name.description: Name by which a party is known and which is usually used to identify that party.

CreditorAgent.title: CreditorAgent
CreditorAgent.description:
Party that manages the account on behalf of the account owner, that is manages the registration and booking of entries on the account, calculates balances on the account and provides information about the account.

This is the servicer of the beneficiary account.

CreditorAccount.description: Provides the details to identify the beneficiary account.

SecondaryIdentification.title: SecondaryIdentification
SecondaryIdentification.description:
This is secondary identification of the account, as assigned by the account servicing institution. 
This can be used by building societies to additionally identify accounts with a roll number (in addition to a sort code and account number combination).

SchemeName.title: SchemeName
SchemeName.description: Name of the identification scheme, in a coded form as published in an external list.

Name.title: Name
Name.description:
The account name is the name or names of the account owner(s) represented at an account level.

Note, the account name is not the product name or the nickname of the account.

OB: ASPSPs may carry out name validation for Confirmation of Payee, but it is not mandatory.

Identification.title: Identification
Identification.description: Identification assigned by an institution to identify an account. This identification is known by the account owner.

SupplementaryData.title: SupplementaryData
SupplementaryData.description: Additional information that can not be captured in the structured fields and/or any other specific block.

InstructedAmount.title: InstructedAmount
InstructedAmount.description:
Amount of money to be moved between the debtor and creditor, before deduction of charges, expressed in the currency as ordered by the initiating party.

Usage: This amount has to be transported unchanged through the transaction chain.

Amount.title: Amount
Amount.description: A number of monetary units specified in an active currency where the unit of currency is explicit and compliant with ISO 4217.

Currency.title: Currency
Currency.description: A code allocated to a currency by a Maintenance Agency under an international identification scheme, as described in the latest edition of the international standard ISO 4217 "Codes for the representation of currencies and funds".

DebtorAccount.title: DebtorAccount
DebtorAccount.description: Unambiguous identification of the account of the debtor to which a debit entry will be made as a result of the transaction.

SchemeName.title: SchemeName
SchemeName.description: Name of the identification scheme, in a coded form as published in an external list.

Identification.title: Identification
Identification.description: Identification assigned by an institution to identify an account. This identification is known by the account owner.

Name.title: Name
Name.description:
The account name is the name or names of the account owner(s) represented at an account level, as displayed by the ASPSP's online channels.

Note, the account name is not the product name or the nickname of the account.

SecondaryIdentification.title: SecondaryIdentification
SecondaryIdentification.description:
This is secondary identification of the account, as assigned by the account servicing institution. 
This can be used by building societies to additionally identify accounts with a roll number (in addition to a sort code and account number combination).

CreditorAccount.title: CreditorAccount
CreditorAccount.description: Unambiguous identification of the account of the creditor to which a credit entry will be posted as a result of the payment transaction.

SchemeName.title: SchemeName
SchemeName.description: Name of the identification scheme, in a coded form as published in an external list.

Identification.title: Identification
Identification.description: Identification assigned by an institution to identify an account. This identification is known by the account owner.

Name.title: Name

The account name is the name or names of the account owner(s) represented at an account level.

Note, the account name is not the product name or the nickname of the account.

OB: ASPSPs may carry out name validation for Confirmation of Payee, but it is not mandatory.

SecondaryIdentification.description:
This is secondary identification of the account, as assigned by the account servicing institution. 
This can be used by building societies to additionally identify accounts with a roll number (in addition to a sort code and account number combination).

RemittanceInformation.title: RemittanceInformation
RemittanceInformation.description: Information supplied to enable the matching of an entry with the items that the transfer is intended to settle, such as commercial invoices in an accounts' receivable system.

Unstructured.title: Unstructured
Unstructured.description: Information supplied to enable the matching/reconciliation of an entry with the items that the payment is intended to settle, such as commercial invoices in an accounts' receivable system, in an unstructured form.

Reference.title: Reference
Reference.description:
Unique reference, as assigned by the creditor, to unambiguously refer to the payment transaction.

Usage: If available, the initiating party should provide this reference in the structured remittance information, to enable reconciliation by the creditor upon receipt of the amount of money.

If the business context requires the use of a creditor reference or a payment remit identification, and only one identifier can be passed through the end-to-end chain, the creditor's reference or payment remittance identification should be quoted in the end-to-end transaction identification.

OB: The Faster Payments Scheme can only accept 18 characters for the ReferenceInformation field - which is where this ISO field will be mapped.

OB: ASPSPs may carry out name validation for Confirmation of Payee, but it is not mandatory.

This is secondary identification of the account, as assigned by the account servicing institution. 
This can be used by building societies to additionally identify accounts with a roll number (in addition to a sort code and account number combination).

StatusDetail.title: StatusDetail
StatusDetail.description: Payment status details as per underlying Payment Rail.

LocalInstrument.title: LocalInstrument
LocalInstrument.description:
User community specific instrument.

Usage: This element is used to specify a local instrument, local clearing option and/or further qualify the service or service level.

Status.title: Status
Status.description: Status of a transfer, as assigned by the transaction administrator.

StatusReason.title: StatusReason
StatusReason.description: Reason Code provided for the status of a transfer.

StatusReasonDescription.title: StatusReasonDescription
StatusReasonDescription.description: Reason provided for the status of a transfer.

ExchangeRateInformation_60.description: Provides details on the currency exchange rate and contract.

UnitCurrency.title: UnitCurrency
UnitCurrency.description: Currency in which the rate of exchange is expressed in a currency exchange. In the example 1GBP = xxxCUR, the unit currency is GBP.

ExchangeRate.title: ExchangeRate
ExchangeRate.description: The factor used for conversion of an amount from one currency to another. This reflects the price at which one currency was bought with another currency.

RateType.title: RateType
RateType.description: Specifies the type used to complete the currency exchange.

ContractIdentification.title: ContractIdentification
ContractIdentification.description: Unique and unambiguous reference to the foreign exchange contract agreed between the initiating party/creditor and the debtor agent.
